column4: Oh man.. I want to just set this thing to go and install and go to sleep
alright, time for some sleep
I'm goign to get some sleep, and probably be back in a few hours... I hate myself.
WHY is the installation thing stuck at 0%!?
THERE we are...
I think it's finally doing something...
is there a browser available for xubuntu, other than firefox?
I think firefox is a bit of a resource hog on this old machine
depends how feature-full you want the browser to be, epiphany is a smaller gecko browser, dillo is about as light as you can go and still be in gui
what is this "gecko" and "dillo" you speak of?
gecko is the engine that firefox runs on, so epiphany is sort of a baby version of firefox. Dillo is basically the lightest graphical browser you can get
and where do about getting this 'dillo' ?
dillo is in universe
noob here, so I'm just goign to pretend like you understand..
does dillo have macromedia flash, adobe acrobat reader, and java support?
no.. opera is as light as you will go for those
somewhat
the applicatiosn button is the one that says 'applications' next to the ubuntu logo on the taskbar
I got that much.. I click on it.. and whatnot.. but where does it say "Add/Remove..."; no where!
it -should- say it immediately below it
In Xubuntu?
i wouldnt know, i dont use xubuntu, you're goig to have to wait for someone else, or join #xubuntu
